job.title: DevOps Engineer
job.description: Responsibilities and Duties<br>● Design and implement build systems, including deployment and configuration management<br>● Test & troubleshoot implemented designs<br>● Build and test automation tools for infrastructure provisioning<br>● Handle code deployments in all environments<br>● Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve<br>● Provide technical guidance and educate team members and coworkers on development<br>and operations<br>● Brainstorm for new ideas and ways to improve delivery<br>● Consult with peers for feedback during design & testing phases<br>● Build, maintain, and monitor configuration standards<br>● Maintain day-to-day management and administration of projects<br>● Manage CI and CD tools in collaboration with the team<br>● Document and design various processes; update existing processes<br>● Improve infrastructure development and application development<br>● Follow all best practices and procedures as established by the company<br>Required Qualifications<br>● Minimum 3 years’ previous commercial experience in development and operations, or related IT, computer, or operations field<br>● Previous experience with software development, infrastructure development, or development and operations<br>● Strong experience with Linux-based infrastructure, databases, CI/CD tools, scripting such as JavaScript, PHP, Python, Perl, & Ruby<br>● Strong experience with configuration management tools, such as Puppet, Chef, and Ansible<br>● Strong experience with development tools, including JIRA and Git<br>● Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly<br>and confidently<br>● Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management<br>● Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently<br>● Able to physically stand, bend, squat, and lift equipment up to 30 pounds or more<br>● Self-motivated and takes initiative with little direction<br>● Eligibility to work in the United States
